channel.title: Good recent comedies?
channel.description: I'm looking for some good comedies from the last few years to watch on an upcoming flight, any suggestions?

item.title: Good recent comedies?
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:26, topic:326767”]I havent seen the others but Eurotrip was the worst fucking movie i’ve seen in years. Fucking complete trash.[/quote]Are you shitting me? That’s one of the best movies I’ve seen. What was so awful about it?

EDIT:
Role Models was a pretty funny movie.

Read full topic

item.description:

la­wl:

alright decided ill watch the hangover on flight, i love you man on return flight, downloaded role models too

In my opinion, I love you man was dumb. It’s like a romance comedy about 2 guys becoming friends.

item.title: Good recent comedies?
item.dc:creator: @akl akl
item.description:
@akl wrote:

I always travel in Emirates, my dad’s their IT Manager so basically free first, business and economy tickets.
I’m just underaged for first class so…

Read full topic

item.title: Good recent comedies?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Emirates is an awesome plane company. Their economy class seats have private screens for movie viewing, and the movies are new. For example, there was stuff like the latest spider man when I went to New Zealand back in ~2004.

Read full topic

item.title: Good recent comedies?
item.dc:creator: @Stork Stork
item.description:
@Stork wrote:

Flight of the concords is pretty damn funny, but some people don’t get into it. Might be worth a try though.

The Hangover was probs my comedy of the year 2009, along with Tropic Thunder if you haven’t seen it. Pineapple express was a close runner up, and Role Models was pretty damn good.

Read full topic

item.title: Good recent comedies?
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

The Hangover.

When I meet people I like to start singing the song from that movie. “We’re the ___ best friends that anybody could ever have!” Where ___ is the number of people you are with. Most people kind of just stare at you, as if to say “Hey, I was just introduced to you three seconds ago and now you’re singing like a kid with down syndrome about how we will be friends forever.” No matter; this is why you must always sing the song loudly and with reckless abandon. Passersby will stare in envy at such insoluble bonds of friendship that could inspire such a soliloquy.

Read full topic

item.title: Good recent comedies?
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:31, topic:326767”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=423175.msg3112133#msg3112133 date=1264630389]

Wait a sec, dont the planes have all these movies already? just press play on the screen on the seat?

sry i dont fly first class
[/quote]

Its in economy class on almost all planes. Or at least Emirates, Singapore and air New Zealand.[/quote]
really it depends on what air liner you fly on here, most of them dont have it and ive yet to see one with on demand movies in economy class
only a few airliners here have individual screens per seat, too
in addition, i wanted a good movie, most airplane movies suck

Read full topic

item.title: Good recent comedies?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:24, topic:326767”]Here’s a list of a few comedies I’ve downloaded and seen lately:

  • The Hangover (One of the funniest movie’s I have ever seen)
  • I Love You Man (Great movie; one of the main characters from below movie)
  • Forgetting Sarah Marshall (Just saw this last; funny)
  • Eurotrip (Old, but only recently saw it. GREAT movie.)

I’m going to check out Role Models soon.[/quote]I havent seen the others but Eurotrip was the worst fucking movie i’ve seen in years. Fucking complete trash.

Read full topic

item.title: Good recent comedies?
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

Here’s a list of a few comedies I’ve downloaded and seen lately:

  • The Hangover (One of the funniest movie’s I have ever seen)
  • I Love You Man (Great movie; one of the main characters from below movie)
  • Forgetting Sarah Marshall (Just saw this last; funny)
  • Eurotrip (Old, but only recently saw it. GREAT movie.)

I’m going to check out Role Models soon.

Read full topic

item.title: Good recent comedies?
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:18, topic:326767”][quote author=the bank link=topic=423175.msg3107184#msg3107184 date=1264252482]

Hmm I’d skip straight over the movies (personally I’ve seen about 80 in the past 3 months) and move onto short programme TV series. Currently watching Nitro Circus, if you haven’t watched them and want to laugh a lot then I recommend them!

Plus you’ll be able to download enough to fill the whole flight, without landing midmovie
[/quote]I love Nitro circus. I’m not sure if you guys get Spike where you live, but Spike had a Nitro Circus marathon that showed the entire second(?) season back to back. I stayed up for it all

Johnny is my idol.

Oh so when I stop riding it becomes cool… I see how it is.[/quote]It’s not all about riding…

Read full topic
